sentences.english: All of them insisted on my staying with them a few days longer.
sentences.chinese: 他們所有的人都堅持要我再跟他們多呆幾天時間。

sentences.english: For the past few days, there has instead been rioting in the square.
sentences.chinese: 在過去的幾天裏，廣場上沒有垃圾，倒是有一場暴亂。

sentences.english: I seldom oppose Israel and Israeli teams these days.
sentences.chinese: 我很少反對以色列和以色列隊這幾天。

sentences.english: Again, let him get used to the fastened halter for several days.
sentences.chinese: 再次，讓他習慣了被系阿爾泰了好幾天。

sentences.english: I'm afraid the hOtel's full on those dates.
sentences.chinese: 那幾天逸旅館恐怕都客滿了。

sentences.english: I have some problems at home these days could you please ask Mr. Wang for permission to leave?
sentences.chinese: 我這幾天家裏有事，你能幫我向王老師請假嗎？

sentences.english: After a few days, so a lot oh, grow out smallpox in India.
sentences.chinese: 過了幾天，好了很多哦，痘印淡下去了。

sentences.english: Recently, I found out he has not disturbed his dog dish of food in days.
sentences.chinese: 最近我發現它幾天都不碰盛狗食的盆子。

sentences.english: I should know in a couple of days. I'll get back to you.
sentences.chinese: 過幾天我應當會知談，到時候再告訴你吧。

sentences.english: Getting over a hundred people to sign up for anything these days is a tough enough task.
sentences.chinese: 百餘人簽約的事情，這幾天是艱鉅的任務。

sentences.english: I catch a cold these days, do not know what to patulin buy is gift nice?
sentences.chinese: 我這幾天感冒，不知買什麼感冒藥纔好？

sentences.english: Just after a few days, the cat wanted that fat.
sentences.chinese: 沒過幾天，貓想要那罐肥肉了。

sentences.english: It took the police only several days to break the case.
sentences.chinese: 警察只用了幾天就破案了。

sentences.english: A few days ago, Adrian bought six bottles of ink at a $1 Store.
sentences.chinese: 幾天前，阿德里恩買了六瓶墨水在1美元商店。

sentences.english: These cloudy days depress us all.
The forest fire has raged for several days.
sentences.chinese: 森林大火已經燃燒了好幾天。

definition: a few years/several years/how many years
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
a moment/a while/in a moment/also pr. [yi1 hui3]
(in the) past/former/previous/to go over/to pass by
a while/a spell/a short time/a burst
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
to hear (sth said)/one hears (that)/hearsay/listening and speaking
